chargeHist.descr: Burglary of a Building or Dwelling

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Request to Substitute Judge
Same as Complaint.

(1:29 PM case called.) All parties and court personnel appear via Zoom. 
Defendant Tyler J. Goplin in court. Attorney Christopher Wilhelm in court for Tyler J. Goplin. Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin.
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. 
Parties advise are ready to proceed.
Defendant waives right to a personal appearance as the Judge is appearing via Zoom. Court accepts the defendant's waiver to a personal appearance.
State calls Officer Edward Bell of the Altoona Police Department, who is sworn and testifies.
Attorney Wilhelm conducts cross-examination of Officer Bell. Witness excused.
State moves for bind over and makes argument.
Attorney Wilhelm argues against bind over and moves for dismissal for Count 3. Attorney Wilhelm also moves for dismissal of Count 2.
Attorney Wilhelm makes no argument regarding Count 1.
Court finds probable cause and binds the case over.
Attorney Wilhelm to schedule an Arraignment with Branch 4 Judicial Assistant.

9:33 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Tyler J. Goplin not in court.  Attorney Christopher Wilhelm appeared by video for Tyler J. Goplin.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

11:33am Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tyler Goplin appeared by video, in custody from the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Christopher Wilhelm appeared in court. Waives reading of the complaint. Time limits for preliminary hearing waived. 

Defense moves to dismiss Count 3 and Count 4 base of the four corners of the complaint. Court requests that counsel file a formal motion and set a motion hearing in Br. 4.

Bond is set.
